description: [RFI] Former US president Jimmy Carter, who died on Sunday aged 100, was well known for his diplomatic skills and commitment to respecting human rights - much less so for his African legacy. And yet he was the first US president to visit sub-Saharan Africa and during his short term in office from 1977 to 1981 he worked hard to enable the transformation of racist Rhodesia into an independent Zimbabwe.
title: Southern Africa: The Largely Unsung Role of U.S. Former President Carter in Southern Africa

description: [Africa Renewal] Maguette Ba, a young climate activist, advocates for a clean environment in her home country of Senegal. At 23, she wants to protect natural resources, raise awareness among young people and propose solutions suited to African realities.
title: Africa: Climate Youth Advocate Making a Difference

description: [Africa Check] A year of fact-checking: Lessons learned as an Africa Check researcher
title: Africa: A Year of Fact-Checking - Lessons Learned As an Africa Check Researcher

description: [Leadership] President Bola Tinubu has described former President of the United States, Jimmy Carter who died on Sunday as a true friend of Nigeria and the African continent.
title: Africa: Carter a True Friend of Nigeria, Africa - - Tinubu

description: [Ethiopian Herald] Preparations are underway in Ethiopia for the 38th Ordinary Session of the Assembly of the African Union (AU), along with the 46th Ordinary Session of the Executive Council. Scheduled to take place from February 12- 16, 2025, these significant gatherings will bring together African leaders to address critical issues facing the continent.
title: Africa: Rolling Out the Red Carpet for Africa's Mammoth Gathering

description: [Premium Times] The Carter Center also disclosed that he died 13 months after entering hospice care at his home in the small town of Plains, Georgia.
title: Africa: Former US President Jimmy Carter Dies At 100

description: [UN News] The UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Sunday expressed his deep sadness at the passing of former United States President Jimmy Carter, who has died aged 100, at his home in Plains, Georgia.
title: Africa: UN Chief Hails 'Peacemaker, Human Rights Champion', Former President Jimmy Carter

description: [UN News] The Amazonian city of Belém, Brazil, will be the global focus of efforts to tackle the climate crisis next year, when it hosts one of the most significant UN climate conferences in recent years. However, well before the event in November, 2025 will see plenty of opportunities to make important progress on several climate-related issues, from the staggering levels of plastic pollution to financing the shift to a cleaner global economy.
title: Africa: The Climate Crisis - 5 Things to Watch Out for in 2025
